originContent: **Transform your GitHub Actions runner into a [Nix](https://zero-to-nix.com/concepts/nix/) ‚ùÑÔ∏è powerhouse by ruthlessly slashing pre-installed bloat.**
translatedContent: **Transform your GitHub Actions runner into a [Nix](https://zero-to-nix.com/concepts/nix/) ‚ùÑÔ∏è powerhouse by ruthlessly slashing pre-installed bloat.**

originContent: GitHub Actions runners come with meager disk space for Nix - a mere ~20GB.
translatedContent: GitHub Actions runners come with meager disk space for Nix - a mere ~20GB.

originContent: *Nothing but Nix* **brutally purges** unnecessary software, giving you **65GB to 130GB** for your Nix store! üí™
translatedContent: *Nothing but Nix* **brutally purges** unnecessary software, giving you **65GB to 130GB** for your Nix store! üí™

originContent: Add this action **before** installing Nix in your workflow:
translatedContent: Add this action **before** installing Nix in your workflow:
- Only supports official **Ubuntu** GitHub Actions runners

originContent: - Only supports official **Ubuntu** GitHub Actions runners

translatedContent: ## The Problem: Making Room for Nix to Thrive üå±

originContent: ## The Problem: Making Room for Nix to Thrive üå±

translatedContent: Standard GitHub Actions runners are stuffed with *"bloatware"* you'll never use in a Nix workflow:

originContent: Standard GitHub Actions runners are stuffed with *"bloatware"* you'll never use in a Nix workflow:

translatedContent: - üåç Web browsers. Lots of them. Gotta have 'em all!

originContent: - üåç Web browsers. Lots of them. Gotta have 'em all!
translatedContent: - üê≥ Docker images consuming gigabytes of precious disk space

originContent: - üê≥ Docker images consuming gigabytes of precious disk space
translatedContent: - üíª Unnecessary language runtimes (.NET, Ruby, PHP, Java...)

originContent: - üíª Unnecessary language runtimes (.NET, Ruby, PHP, Java...)

translatedContent: - üìö Documentation no one will ever read

originContent: - üìö Documentation no one will ever read

translatedContent: This bloat leaves only ~20GB for your Nix store - barely enough for serious Nix builds! üòû

originContent: This bloat leaves only ~20GB for your Nix store - barely enough for serious Nix builds! üòû

translatedContent: ## The Solution: Nothing but Nix Ô∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è

originContent: ## The Solution: Nothing but Nix Ô∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è

translatedContent: **Nothing but Nix** takes a scorched-earth approach to GitHub Actions runners and mercilessly reclaims disk space using a two-phase attack:

originContent: **Nothing but Nix** takes a scorched-earth approach to GitHub Actions runners and mercilessly reclaims disk space using a two-phase attack:

translatedContent: 1. **Initial Slash:** Instantly creates a large `/nix` volume (~65GB) by claiming free space from `/mnt`

originContent: 1. **Initial Slash:** Instantly creates a large `/nix` volume (~65GB) by claiming free space from `/mnt`
translatedContent: 2. **Background Rampage:** While your workflow continues, we ruthlessly eliminate unnecessary software to expand your `/nix` volume up to ~130GB

originContent: 2. **Background Rampage:** While your workflow continues, we ruthlessly eliminate unnecessary software to expand your `/nix` volume up to ~130GB

translatedContent: The file system purge is powered by `rmz` (from the [Fast Unix Commands (FUC)](https://github.com/SUPERCILEX/fuc) project) - a high-performance alternative to `rm` that makes space reclamation blazing fast! ‚ö°

originContent: The file system purge is powered by `rmz` (from the [Fast Unix Commands (FUC)](https://github.com/SUPERCILEX/fuc) project) - a high-performance alternative to `rm` that makes space reclamation blazing fast! ‚ö°
translatedContent: - Outperforms standard `rm` by an order of magnitude

originContent: - Outperforms standard `rm` by an order of magnitude

translatedContent: - **Reclaims disk space in seconds rather than minutes!** Ô∏è‚è±Ô∏è

originContent: - **Reclaims disk space in seconds rather than minutes!** Ô∏è‚è±Ô∏è

translatedContent: The end result? A GitHub Actions runner with **65GB to 130GB** of Nix-ready space! üòÅ

originContent: The end result? A GitHub Actions runner with **65GB to 130GB** of Nix-ready space! üòÅ

translatedContent: Unlike other solutions, **Nothing but Nix** grows your `/nix` volume dynamically:

originContent: Unlike other solutions, **Nothing but Nix** grows your `/nix` volume dynamically:

translatedContent: 1. **Initial Volume Creation (1-10 seconds):** (*depending on Hatchet Protocol*)

originContent: 1. **Initial Volume Creation (1-10 seconds):** (*depending on Hatchet Protocol*)
translatedContent: - Creates a loop device from free space on `/mnt`

originContent: - Creates a loop device from free space on `/mnt`
translatedContent: - Sets up a BTRFS filesystem in RAID0 configuration

originContent: - Sets up a BTRFS filesystem in RAID0 configuration
translatedContent: - Mounts with compression and performance tuning

originContent: - Mounts with compression and performance tuning
translatedContent: - Provides a 65GB `/nix` immediately, even before the purge begins

originContent: - Provides a 65GB `/nix` immediately, even before the purge begins

translatedContent: - Monitors for newly freed space as bloat is eliminated

originContent: - Monitors for newly freed space as bloat is eliminated
translatedContent: - Dynamically adds an expansion disk to the `/nix` volume

originContent: - Dynamically adds an expansion disk to the `/nix` volume
translatedContent: - Rebalances the filesystem to incorporate new space

originContent: - Rebalances the filesystem to incorporate new space

translatedContent: The `/nix` volume automatically **grows during workflow execution** üé©ü™Ñ

originContent: The `/nix` volume automatically **grows during workflow execution** üé©ü™Ñ

translatedContent: ### Choose Your Weapon: The Hatchet Protocol ü™ì

originContent: ### Choose Your Weapon: The Hatchet Protocol ü™ì

translatedContent: Control the level of annihilation üí• with the `hatchet-protocol` input:

originContent: Control the level of annihilation üí• with the `hatchet-protocol` input:
hatchet-protocol: 'cleave'  # Options: holster, carve, cleave (default), rampage
translatedContent: hatchet-protocol: 'cleave'  # Options: holster, carve, cleave (default), rampage
| Protocol | `/nix` | Description                                      | Purge apt  | Purge docker | Purge snap | Purged file systems     |

originContent: | Protocol | `/nix` | Description                                      | Purge apt  | Purge docker | Purge snap | Purged file systems     |

translatedContent: | Holster  | ~65GB  | Keep the hatchet sheathed, use space from `/mnt` | No         | No           | No         | None                    |

originContent: | Holster  | ~65GB  | Keep the hatchet sheathed, use space from `/mnt` | No         | No           | No         | None                    |
translatedContent: | Carve    | ~85GB  | Craft and combine free space from `/` and `/mnt` | No         | No           | No         | None                    |

originContent: | Carve    | ~85GB  | Craft and combine free space from `/` and `/mnt` | No         | No           | No         | None                    |
translatedContent: | Cleave   | ~115GB | Make powerful, decisive cuts to large packages   | Minimal    | Yes          | Yes        | `/opt` and `/usr/local` |

originContent: | Cleave   | ~115GB | Make powerful, decisive cuts to large packages   | Minimal    | Yes          | Yes        | `/opt` and `/usr/local` |
translatedContent: | Rampage  | ~130GB | Relentless, brutal elimination of all bloat      | Aggressive | Yes          | Yes        | Muahahaha! üî•üåé         |

originContent: | Rampage  | ~130GB | Relentless, brutal elimination of all bloat      | Aggressive | Yes          | Yes        | Muahahaha! üî•üåé         |

translatedContent: - **Holster** when you need the runner's tools to remain fully functional

originContent: - **Holster** when you need the runner's tools to remain fully functional
translatedContent: - **Carve** to preserve functional runner tooling but claim all free space for Nix

originContent: - **Carve** to preserve functional runner tooling but claim all free space for Nix
translatedContent: - **Cleave** (*default*) for a good balance of space and functionality

originContent: - **Cleave** (*default*) for a good balance of space and functionality
translatedContent: - **Rampage** when you need maximum Nix space and don't care what breaks `#nix-is-life`

originContent: - **Rampage** when you need maximum Nix space and don't care what breaks `#nix-is-life`

translatedContent: By default, the purging process executes silently in the background while your workflow continues. But if you want to watch the slaughter in real-time:

originContent: By default, the purging process executes silently in the background while your workflow continues. But if you want to watch the slaughter in real-time:

translatedContent: Control how much space to spare from the Nix store land grab with custom safe haven sizes:

originContent: Control how much space to spare from the Nix store land grab with custom safe haven sizes:

translatedContent: These safe havens define how much space (in MB) will be mercifully spared during space reclamation:

originContent: These safe havens define how much space (in MB) will be mercifully spared during space reclamation:

translatedContent: Increase these values if you need more breathing room on your filesystems, or decrease them to show no mercy! üòà

originContent: Increase these values if you need more breathing room on your filesystems, or decrease them to show no mercy! üòà

translatedContent: ### Grant User Ownership of /nix (Nix Permission Edict) üßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è

originContent: ### Grant User Ownership of /nix (Nix Permission Edict) üßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è

translatedContent: Some Nix installers or configurations expect the `/nix` directory to be writable by the current user. By default, `/nix` is owned by root. If you need user ownership (e.g., for certain Nix installer scripts that don't use `sudo` for all operations within `/nix`), you can enable the `nix-permission-edict`:

originContent: Some Nix installers or configurations expect the `/nix` directory to be writable by the current user. By default, `/nix` is owned by root. If you need user ownership (e.g., for certain Nix installer scripts that don't use `sudo` for all operations within `/nix`), you can enable the `nix-permission-edict`:

translatedContent: When `nix-permission-edict` is set to `true`, the action will run `sudo chown -R "$(id --user)":"$(id --group)" /nix` after mounting `/nix`.

originContent: When `nix-permission-edict` is set to `true`, the action will run `sudo chown -R "$(id --user)":"$(id --group)" /nix` after mounting `/nix`.

translatedContent: Now go and build something amazing with all that glorious Nix store space! ‚ùÑÔ∏è

originContent: Now go and build something amazing with all that glorious Nix store space! ‚ùÑÔ∏è
